intro: [WRONG START] Apotheca interrupta, commonly known as the interrupted cup lichen, is a species of lichen belonging to the family Lecanoraceae. It is characterized by its foliose thallus, which is typically pale green to yellowish in color. The apothecia are disc-shaped and have a distinct, interrupted margin, giving the species its common name. It grows on bark and soil in temperate and subtropical regions, often in shaded environments. The lichen is chemically complex, containing various secondary metabolites that contribute to its ecological interactions and potential medicinal applications.
